project.name: C-C078B-PSQL-06-ST01-DT04-DF05-CF02-01
project.description: Creating test case using base program. Added an environment variable read to the function definition. Completed injection.

iopair.name: C-C078B-PSQL-06-ST01-DT04-DF05-CF02-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: initalize a database Read a string from the input. Check first if it has any command separators and then run it though a URL decoding algorithm. Then use this string to perform an nslookup by appending it to the end of the command. This allows the user to run arbitrary commands by suplying command separators encoded in url encoding.

scoring_formula.formula: (UTF8 OR ASCII) AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

iopair.name: C-C078B-PSQL-06-ST01-DT04-DF05-CF02-01-GOOD-02
iopair.description: perform a select Read a string from the input. Check first if it has any command separators and then run it though a URL decoding algorithm. Then use this string to perform an nslookup by appending it to the end of the command. This allows the user to run arbitrary commands by suplying command separators encoded in url encoding.

process.script: sleep 22 && $SS_TC_DEPS/bin/psql -h ss-localhost -d booktown -p 8432 -c "SELECT * FROM books WHERE title = 'Dune'"
if [[ -s "$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_INSTALL/postgres.pid" ]]; then kill $(cat "$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_INSTALL/postgres.pid"); else echo "Skipping postgres kill, no PID file."; fi;

scoring_formula.formula: GOOD-02 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

Then use this string to perform an nslookup by appending it to the end of the command. This allows the user to run arbitrary commands by suplying command separators encoded in url encoding.

process.script: sleep 22 && $SS_TC_DEPS/bin/psql -d booktown -h ss-localhost -p 8432 -c "insert into books values ('12345','Good Oh Three')"
if [[ -s "$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_INSTALL/postgres.pid" ]]; then kill $(cat "$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_INSTALL/postgres.pid"); else echo "Skipping postgres kill, no PID file."; fi;

scoring_formula.formula: GOOD-03 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

Then use this string to perform an nslookup by appending it to the end of the command. This allows the user to run arbitrary commands by suplying command separators encoded in url encoding.
